reasoning: Umbrella term including complete mole, partial mole, invasive mole, and choriocarcinoma. Global incidence approximately 1-2 per 1000 pregnancies (higher in Asia, lower in Western countries). Estimated at ~3.2 per 100k person-years based on pregnancy rates and molar pregnancy frequency.
source: Lurain JR. (2010). Gestational trophoblastic disease I: epidemiology, pathology, clinical presentation and diagnosis of gestational trophoblastic disease, and management of hydatidiform mole. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 203(6):531-539
